item.title: Hackers exploiting flaws in SimpleHelp RMM to breach networks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are believed to be exploiting recently fixed SimpleHelp Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) software vulnerabilities to gain initial access to target networks. [...]

item.title: Google to kill Chrome Sync on older Chrome browser versions
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Google announced that the Chrome Sync feature will be discontinued in early 2025 for Chrome versions older than four years. [...]

item.title: Garmin GPS watches crashing, stuck in triangle 'reboot loop'
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Garmin users are reporting that their watches crash when using apps that require GPS access and then get stuck in a reboot loop, showing a blue triangle logo. [...]

item.title: New Apple CPU side-channel attacks steal data from browsers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A team of security researchers has disclosed new side-channel vulnerabilities in modern Apple processors that could steal sensitive information from web browsers. [...]

item.title: Engineering giant Smiths Group discloses security breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: London-based engineering giant Smiths Group disclosed a security breach after unknown attackers gained access to the company's systems. [...]

item.title: Signal will let you sync old messages when linking new devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Signal is finally adding a new feature that allows users to synchronize their old message history from their primary iOS or Android devices to newly linked devices like desktops and iPads. [...]

item.title: PowerSchool starts notifying victims of massive data breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Education software giant PowerSchool has started notifying individuals in the U.S. and Canada whose personal data was exposed in a late December 2024 cyberattack. [...]

item.title: What's Yours is Mine: Is Your Business Ready for Cryptojacking Attacks?
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Pentera
item.description: Cryptojacking may be stealthy, but its impact is anything but. From inflated cloud bills to sluggish performance, it's a threat that companies can't ignore. Learn more from Pentera about how automated security validation can protect your org from these threats. [...]

item.title: Microsoft tests Edge Scareware Blocker to block tech support scams
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has started testing a new "scareware blocker" feature for the Edge web browser on Windows PCs, which uses machine learning (ML) to detect tech support scams. [...]

item.title: DeepSeek halts new signups amid "large-scale" cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Chinese AI platform DeepSeek has disabled registrations on its DeepSeek-V3 chat platform due to an ongoing "large-scale" cyberattack targeting its services. [...]

item.title: Bitwarden makes it harder to hack password vaults without MFA
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Open-source password manager Bitwarden is adding an extra layer of security for accounts that are not protected by two-factor authentication, requiring email verification before allowing access to accounts. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: January Windows security updates break audio playback
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has confirmed that the January 2025 Windows security updates are breaking audio playback on some systems with external DACs (digital-to-analog converters). [...]

item.title: Apple fixes this year’s first actively exploited zero-day bug
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Apple has released security updates to fix this year's first zero-day vulnerability, tagged as actively exploited in attacks targeting iPhone users. [...]
